body:
Note for triage: looks like a regression when entities deleted due to changes in one relationship are then also severed by changes in another relationship.

@edwiles Workaround is to call `db.ChangeTracker.DetectChanges();` between `Inputs.Things.Clear();` and `Outputs.ThingOutputs.Clear();`.
Thanks @ajcvickers , that workaround is working for our real code. Would appreciate a fix when you can.

issue.title: Exception replacing multi-level relationship in EF7

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.title: Avoid throwing relationship severed exceptions until DetectChanges is finished

issue.body:
Fixes #30122

Because the entities for which the relationship is being severed may end up being deleted later on in DetectChanges.

issue.title: Prevent re-entrance into DetectChanges

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #30122
Fixes #30135

EF7 contained some new calls to local `DetectChanges`. This resulted in re-entrance into `DetectChanges` for some types of graphs. This change prevents that.

issue.title: [release/7.0] Prevent re-entrance into DetectChanges

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Port of #30204
Fixes #30122
Fixes #30135

**Description**

EF7 contains some new calls to local `DetectChanges`. This resulted in re-entrance into `DetectChanges` for some types of graphs. This change prevents that.

**Customer impact**

So far two different reported issues where the re-entrance caused incorrect behavior, and we expect more cases of exceptions or incorrect state depending on the shape and state of graphs being traversed.

**How found**

Multiple customer reports on 7.0.

**Regression**

Yes.

**Testing**

New tests added for the reported graphs and similar cases.

**Risk**

Low; flag to prevent re-entrance, does not need to be thread-safe, and a quirk was added to revert back to older behavior.
